section: C:/Users/unumuser/OneDrive - Institute of Technology Carlow/Software Development 4th year/Project/Repo/Context/Controller.py Go to the documentation of this file.00001 """! @brief Defines the Controller class.""" 00002 00036 from transformers import AutoTokenizer, AutoModelForMaskedLM 00037 00038 import transformers 00039 import joblib 00040 import regex 00041 00042 import nltk 00043 00044 from nltk.corpus import wordnet 00045 00046 import joblib 00047 import Levenshtein as leven 00048 from operator import itemgetter 00049 import difflib 00050 00051 nltk.download("omw-1.4") 00052 nltk.download("words") 00053 00054 DATADIRECTORY = "data/" 00055 MODELNAME = "distilroberta-base" 00056 MODELLOCATION = DATADIRECTORY + MODELNAME + "/" + MODELNAME + "Model" 00057 TOKENIZERLOCATION = DATADIRECTORY + MODELNAME + "/" + MODELNAME + "Tokenizer" 00058 PIPELINETYPE = "fill-mask" 00059 00060 00061 class Controller: 00062 """! The Controller class. 00063 Defines the Controller class that contains the main functionality of the spell checker. 00064 """ 00065 00066 def __init__(self): 00067 """! The Controller class initializer.""" 00068 self.contextError = "" 00069 self.wordNet = wordnet 00070 self.model = self.loadModel(MODELLOCATION) 00071 self.tokenizer = self.loadTokenizer(TOKENIZERLOCATION) 00072 self.pipeline = self.createPipeline() 00073 self.modelResults = [] 00074 self.modelGuessSynset = [] 00075 self.editDistances = [] 00076 self.predictedValues = [] 00077 self.dictionary = self.loadDictionary() 00078 self.similarWords = [] 00079 self.preWord = "" 00080 self.postWord = "" 00081 self.wordSet = set() 00082 nltk.download("wordnet") 00083 00084 def addMask(self, input): 00085 """! Replaces the [*] contained input with a mask from the tokeniser. 00086 @param input The complete input given by the user 00087 """ 00088 mask = self.tokenizer.mask_token 00089 input = regex.sub("[[A-Za-z]+]", mask, input) 00090 return input 00091 00092 def containsError(self, input): 00093 """! Returns True if the user given input has [*] contained within the input. 00094 @param input The complete input given by the user 00095 """ 00096 pattern = "[[A-Za-z]+]" 00097 if regex.search(pattern, input): 00098 return True 00099 else: 00100 return False 00101 00102 def createPipeline(self): 00103 """! Creates a transformer pipeline for the model.""" 00104 pipeline = transformers.pipeline( 00105 PIPELINETYPE, model=self.model, tokenizer=self.tokenizer 00106 ) 00107 return pipeline 00108 00109 def crossCheck(self, input): 00110 """! Replaces the [*] contained input with a mask from the tokeniser. 00111 @param input The complete input given by the user 00112 """ 00113 similarWords = difflib.get_close_matches(input, self.dictionary) 00114 return similarWords 00115 00116 def extractWord(self, input): 00117 """! Returns only the contents of [*] contained within the input given by the user. 00118 @param input The complete input given by the user 00119 """ 00120 return input[input.find("[") + 1 : input.find("]")] 00121 00122 def extractPreAndPost(self, input): 00123 """! Returns the word before the error and the next word after the error. 00124 @param input The complete input given by the user 00125 """ 00126 beforeAndAfter = input.split("[" + str(self.contextError) + "]") 00127 before = beforeAndAfter[0] 00128 after = beforeAndAfter[1] 00129 pre, post = "", "" 00130 if len(before) > 2: 00131 pre = before.split(" ")[-2] 00132 if pre[:-1] == ",": 00133 post = post[:-1] 00134 if len(after) > 2: 00135 post = after.split(" ")[1] 00136 for char in post: 00137 if char in "?.!/;:": 00138 post = post.replace(char, "") 00139 return pre, post 00140 00141 def getEditDistance(self, originalWord, stringCompared): 00142 """! Returns the edit distance between the original word and the string compared. 00143 @param originalWord The original word given by the user 00144 @param stringCompared The string to be compared to the original word 00145 """ 00146 if len(originalWord) < len(stringCompared): 00147 return self.getEditDistance(stringCompared, originalWord) 00148 # When the originalWord is longer than the word to be compared with 00149 if len(stringCompared) == 0: 00150 return len(originalWord) 00151 previousRow = range(len(stringCompared) + 1) 00152 for originalWordindex, charOne in enumerate(originalWord): 00153 currentRow = [originalWordindex + 1] 00154 for comparedWordIndex, charTwo in enumerate(stringCompared): 00155 insertions = previous_row[comparedWordIndex + 1] + 1 00156 deletions = currentRow[comparedWordIndex] + 1 00157 substitutions = previous_row[comparedWordIndex] + (charOne != charTwo) 00158 currentRow.append(min(insertions, deletions, substitutions)) 00159 previous_row = currentRow 00160 return previous_row[-1] 00161 00162 def getEditDistanceList(self): 00163 """! Returns a list of the all potential words with the edit distances between the potential word and the original error.""" 00164 synsetList = self.modelResultsSynset 00165 originalWord = self.contextError 00166 editDistances = [] 00167 for word in synsetList: 00168 distance = self.shortGetEditDistance(originalWord, word) 00169 editDistances.append(distance) 00170 combinedList = list(zip(synsetList, editDistances)) 00171 return combinedList 00172 00173 def getModelPredictions(self, input): 00174 """! Returns a list of the models predictions based on the input given by the user. 00175 @param input The complete input given by the user 00176 """ 00177 return self.pipeline(input) 00178 00179 def getSimilarWords(self, input): 00180 """! Replaces the [*] contained input with a mask from the tokeniser. 00181 @param input The complete input given by the user 00182 """ 00183 similarWords = set() 00184 similarWords = difflib.get_close_matches(input, self.dictionary) 00185 return similarWords 00186 00187 def getSynsets(self, guessedWords): 00188 """! Loads and Returns the model for use by the program from hugginface.com. 00189 @param guessedWords A list of potential Guesses 00190 """ 00191 guesses = set() 00192 wordList = set() 00193 for guess in guessedWords: 00194 guesses.add(guess) 00195 for guess in guesses: 00196 wordList.add(guess) 00197 synsets = self.wordNet.synsets(guess) 00198 for synset in synsets: 00199 for lemma in synset.lemmas(): 00200 print(str(lemma.name()) + ", ", end=" ") 00201 wordList.add(lemma.name().strip().replace("_", " ").lower()) 00202 return wordList 00203 00204 def loadDictionary(self): 00205 """! Loads and Returns the dictionary for use by the program based on the nltk corpus.""" 00206 dictionary = set(w.lower() for w in nltk.corpus.words.words()) 00207 return dictionary 00208 00209 def loadBaseModel(self): 00210 """! Loads and Returns the model for use by the program from hugginface.com.""" 00211 model = AutoModelForMaskedLM.from_pretrained(MODELNAME) 00212 return model 00213 00214 def loadBaseTokenizer(self): 00215 """! Loads and Returns the tokenizer for use by the program from hugginface.com.""" 00216 tokenizer = AutoTokenizer.from_pretrained(MODELNAME) 00217 return tokenizer 00218 00219 def loadModel(self, path): 00220 """! Loads and Returns the prepared model for use by the program 00221 @param path The directory path of the model 00222 """ 00223 return joblib.load(path) 00224 00225 def loadTokenizer(self, path): 00226 """! Loads and Returns the prepared tokenizer that corresponds to the the model for use by the program 00227 @param path The directory path of the tokenizer 00228 """ 00229 return joblib.load(path) 00230 00231 def processInput(self, input: str): 00232 """! Main functionality of the program that processes the input given by the user. 00233 @type input: str 00234 @param input The complete input given by the user 00235 """ 00236 if self.containsError(input): 00237 # gets the word that is the error 00238 self.contextError = self.extractWord(input) 00239 # get word before the error and after the error 00240 self.preWord, self.postWord = self.extractPreAndPost(input) 00241 # replaces the error with an appropriate mask 00242 self.maskedInput = self.addMask(input) 00243 # get the model predictions 00244 self.modelResults = self.getModelPredictions(self.maskedInput) 00245 self.modelResultsSynset = [] 00246 # for each prediction made: 00247 for prediction in self.modelResults: 00248 # gets the predicted word 00249 prediction = prediction.get("token_str").strip() 00250 # creates a list of three words to create two bigrams for comparison 00251 bigramRawInputList = [] 00252 bigramRawInputList.append(self.preWord) 00253 bigramRawInputList.append(prediction) 00254 bigramRawInputList.append(self.postWord) 00255 bigramList = list(nltk.bigrams(bigramRawInputList)) 00256 bigramJoinedList = [] 00257 # joins words with a space for each bigram 00258 for bigram in bigramList: 00259 bigram = " ".join(bigram) 00260 bigramJoinedList.append(bigram) 00261 bigramFinalList = bigramJoinedList[:] 00262 bigramFinalList.append(prediction) 00263 # gets the synsets for each bigram in the list 00264 bigramListResults = self.getSynsets(bigramFinalList) 00265 # Filter out the bigrams only 00266 for word in list(bigramListResults): 00267 for bigram in bigramJoinedList: 00268 if word == bigram: 00269 bigramListResults.remove(word) 00270 # appends the synsets to the full list of synsets 00271 for result in bigramListResults: 00272 self.modelResultsSynset.append(result) 00273 00274 # Filter out any duplicates that may be present 00275 self.modelResultsSynset = list(set(self.modelResultsSynset)) 00276 # returns a set of lists that adds the edit distance to each word in the set 00277 self.editDistances = self.getEditDistanceList() 00278 # sorts the list according to the edit distance in ascending order 00279 self.sortEditDistances() 00280 # Return the top 10 results by shortest edit distance compared to the error 00281 return self.editDistances[:10] 00282 else: 00283 pass 00284 00285 def shortGetEditDistance(self, originalWord, stringCompared): 00286 """! Gets the edit distance required to change strignCompared into original Word using the levenshtein method 00287 @param originalWord The word to be compared to 00288 @param stringCompared The word to be compared to the original word 00289 @return The edit distance between the two words 00290 """ 00291 originalWord = originalWord.lower() 00292 stringCompared = stringCompared.lower() 00293 distance = leven.distance(originalWord, stringCompared) 00294 return distance 00295 00296 def sortEditDistances(self): 00297 """! sorts the list of lists by the edit distance in ascending order""" 00298 self.editDistances.sort(key=itemgetter(1))
